Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpc/dist/src/mul.c

21#include <stdio.h> /* for MPC_ASSERT */
22#include "mpc-impl.h"
23
24#define mpz_add_si(z,x,y) do { \
25 if (y >= 0) \
26 mpz_add_ui (z, x, (long int) y); \
27 else \
28 mpz_sub_ui (z, x, (long int) (-y)); \
29 } while (0);
30
31/* compute z=x*y when x has an infinite part */
32static int
33mul_infinite (mpc_ptr z, mpc_srcptr x, mpc_srcptr y)
34{
35 /* Let x=xr+i*xi and y=yr+i*yi; extract the signs of the operands */
36 int xrs = mpfr_signbit (mpc_realref (x)) ? -1 : 1;
37 int xis = mpfr_signbit (mpc_imagref (x)) ? -1 : 1;
38 int yrs = mpfr_signbit (mpc_realref (y)) ? -1 : 1;
39 int yis = mpfr_signbit (mpc_imagref (y)) ? -1 : 1;
40
41 int u, v;
42
43 /* compute the sign of
44 u = xrs * yrs * xr * yr - xis * yis * xi * yi
45 v = xrs * yis * xr * yi + xis * yrs * xi * yr
46 +1 if positive, -1 if negative, 0 if NaN */
47 if ( mpfr_nan_p (mpc_realref (x)) || mpfr_nan_p (mpc_imagref (x))
48 || mpfr_nan_p (mpc_realref (y)) || mpfr_nan_p (mpc_imagref (y))) {
49 u = 0;
50 v = 0;
51 }
52 else if (mpfr_inf_p (mpc_realref (x))) {
53 /* x = (+/-inf) xr + i*xi */
54 u = ( mpfr_zero_p (mpc_realref (y))
55 || (mpfr_inf_p (mpc_imagref (x)) && mpfr_zero_p (mpc_imagref (y)))
56 || (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_imagref (x)) && mpfr_inf_p (mpc_imagref (y)))
57 || ( (mpfr_inf_p (mpc_imagref (x)) || mpfr_inf_p (mpc_imagref (y)))
58 && xrs*yrs == xis*yis)
59 ? 0 : xrs * yrs);
60 v = ( mpfr_zero_p (mpc_imagref (y))
61 || (mpfr_inf_p (mpc_imagref (x)) && mpfr_zero_p (mpc_realref (y)))
62 || (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_imagref (x)) && mpfr_inf_p (mpc_realref (y)))
63 || ( (mpfr_inf_p (mpc_imagref (x)) || mpfr_inf_p (mpc_imagref (x)))
64 && xrs*yis != xis*yrs)
65 ? 0 : xrs * yis);
66 }
67 else {
68 /* x = xr + i*(+/-inf) with |xr| != inf */
69 u = ( mpfr_zero_p (mpc_imagref (y))
70 || (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_realref (x)) && mpfr_inf_p (mpc_realref (y)))
71 || (mpfr_inf_p (mpc_realref (y)) && xrs*yrs == xis*yis)
72 ? 0 : -xis * yis);
73 v = ( mpfr_zero_p (mpc_realref (y))
74 || (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_realref (x)) && mpfr_inf_p (mpc_imagref (y)))
75 || (mpfr_inf_p (mpc_imagref (y)) && xrs*yis != xis*yrs)
76 ? 0 : xis * yrs);
77 }
78
79 if (u == 0 && v == 0) {
80 /* Naive result is NaN+i*NaN. Obtain an infinity using the algorithm
81 given in Annex G.5.1 of the ISO C99 standard */
82 int xr = (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_realref (x)) || mpfr_nan_p (mpc_realref (x)) ? 0
83 : (mpfr_inf_p (mpc_realref (x)) ? 1 : 0));
84 int xi = (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_imagref (x)) || mpfr_nan_p (mpc_imagref (x)) ? 0
85 : (mpfr_inf_p (mpc_imagref (x)) ? 1 : 0));
86 int yr = (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_realref (y)) || mpfr_nan_p (mpc_realref (y)) ? 0 : 1);
87 int yi = (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_imagref (y)) || mpfr_nan_p (mpc_imagref (y)) ? 0 : 1);
88 if (mpc_inf_p (y)) {
89 yr = mpfr_inf_p (mpc_realref (y)) ? 1 : 0;
90 yi = mpfr_inf_p (mpc_imagref (y)) ? 1 : 0;
91 }
92
93 u = xrs * xr * yrs * yr - xis * xi * yis * yi;
94 v = xrs * xr * yis * yi + xis * xi * yrs * yr;
95 }
96
97 if (u == 0)
98 mpfr_set_nan (mpc_realref (z));
99 else
100 mpfr_set_inf (mpc_realref (z), u);
101
102 if (v == 0)
103 mpfr_set_nan (mpc_imagref (z));
104 else
105 mpfr_set_inf (mpc_imagref (z), v);
106
107 return MPC_INEX (0, 0); /* exact */
108}
109
110
111/* compute z = x*y for Im(y) == 0 */
112static int
113mul_real (mpc_ptr z, mpc_srcptr x, mpc_srcptr y, mpc_rnd_t rnd)
114{
115 int xrs, xis, yrs, yis;
116 int inex;
117
118 /* save signs of operands */
119 xrs = MPFR_SIGNBIT (mpc_realref (x));
120 xis = MPFR_SIGNBIT (mpc_imagref (x));
121 yrs = MPFR_SIGNBIT (mpc_realref (y));
122 yis = MPFR_SIGNBIT (mpc_imagref (y));
123
124 inex = mpc_mul_fr (z, x, mpc_realref (y), rnd);
125 /* Signs of zeroes may be wrong. Their correction does not change the
126 inexact flag. */
127 if (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_realref (z)))
128 mpfr_setsign (mpc_realref (z), mpc_realref (z), MPC_RND_RE(rnd) == MPFR_RNDD
129 || (xrs != yrs && xis == yis), MPFR_RNDN);
130 if (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_imagref (z)))
131 mpfr_setsign (mpc_imagref (z), mpc_imagref (z), MPC_RND_IM (rnd) == MPFR_RNDD
132 || (xrs != yis && xis != yrs), MPFR_RNDN);
133
134 return inex;
135}
136
137
138/* compute z = x*y for Re(y) == 0, and Im(x) != 0 and Im(y) != 0 */
139static int
140mul_imag (mpc_ptr z, mpc_srcptr x, mpc_srcptr y, mpc_rnd_t rnd)
141{
142 int sign;
143 int inex_re, inex_im;
144 int overlap = z == x || z == y;
145 mpc_t rop;
146
147 if (overlap)
148 mpc_init3 (rop, MPC_PREC_RE (z), MPC_PREC_IM (z));
149 else
150 rop [0] = z[0];
151
152 sign = (MPFR_SIGNBIT (mpc_realref (y)) != MPFR_SIGNBIT (mpc_imagref (x)))
153 && (MPFR_SIGNBIT (mpc_imagref (y)) != MPFR_SIGNBIT (mpc_realref (x)));
154
155 inex_re = -mpfr_mul (mpc_realref (rop), mpc_imagref (x), mpc_imagref (y),
156 INV_RND (MPC_RND_RE (rnd)));
157 mpfr_neg (mpc_realref (rop), mpc_realref (rop), MPFR_RNDN); /* exact */
158 inex_im = mpfr_mul (mpc_imagref (rop), mpc_realref (x), mpc_imagref (y),
159 MPC_RND_IM (rnd));
160 mpc_set (z, rop, MPC_RNDNN);
161
162 /* Sign of zeroes may be wrong (note that Re(z) cannot be zero) */
163 if (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_imagref (z)))
164 mpfr_setsign (mpc_imagref (z), mpc_imagref (z), MPC_RND_IM (rnd) == MPFR_RNDD
165 || sign, MPFR_RNDN);
166
167 if (overlap)
168 mpc_clear (rop);
169
170 return MPC_INEX (inex_re, inex_im);
171}
172
173#define MPFR_MANT(x) ((x)->_mpfr_d)
174#define MPFR_PREC(x) ((x)->_mpfr_prec)
175#define MPFR_EXP(x) ((x)->_mpfr_exp)
176#define MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(x) ((MPFR_PREC (x) - 1) / GMP_NUMB_BITS + 1)
177
178#if HAVE_MPFR_FMMA == 0
179static int
180mpc_fmma (mpfr_ptr z, mpfr_srcptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c,
181 mpfr_srcptr d, int sign, mpfr_rnd_t rnd)
182{
183 /* Computes z = ab+cd if sign >= 0, or z = ab-cd if sign < 0.
184 Assumes that a, b, c, d are finite and non-zero; so any multiplication
185 of two of them yielding an infinity is an overflow, and a
186 multiplication yielding 0 is an underflow.
187 Assumes further that z is distinct from a, b, c, d. */
188
189 int inex;
190 mpfr_t u, v;
191 mp_size_t an, bn, cn, dn;
192
193 /* u=a*b, v=sign*c*d exactly */
194 an = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(a);
195 bn = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(b);
196 cn = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(c);
197 dn = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(d);
198 MPFR_MANT(u) = malloc ((an + bn) * sizeof (mp_limb_t));
199 MPFR_MANT(v) = malloc ((cn + dn) * sizeof (mp_limb_t));
200 if (an >= bn)
201 mpn_mul (MPFR_MANT(u), MPFR_MANT(a), an, MPFR_MANT(b), bn);
202 else
203 mpn_mul (MPFR_MANT(u), MPFR_MANT(b), bn, MPFR_MANT(a), an);
204 if ((MPFR_MANT(u)[an + bn - 1] >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) == 0)
205 {
206 mpn_lshift (MPFR_MANT(u), MPFR_MANT(u), an + bn, 1);
207 MPFR_EXP(u) = MPFR_EXP(a) + MPFR_EXP(b) - 1;
208 }
209 else
210 MPFR_EXP(u) = MPFR_EXP(a) + MPFR_EXP(b);
211 if (cn >= dn)
212 mpn_mul (MPFR_MANT(v), MPFR_MANT(c), cn, MPFR_MANT(d), dn);
213 else
214 mpn_mul (MPFR_MANT(v), MPFR_MANT(d), dn, MPFR_MANT(c), cn);
215 if ((MPFR_MANT(v)[cn + dn - 1] >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) == 0)
216 {
217 mpn_lshift (MPFR_MANT(v), MPFR_MANT(v), cn + dn, 1);
218 MPFR_EXP(v) = MPFR_EXP(c) + MPFR_EXP(d) - 1;
219 }
220 else
221 MPFR_EXP(v) = MPFR_EXP(c) + MPFR_EXP(d);
222 MPFR_PREC(u) = (an + bn) * GMP_NUMB_BITS;
223 MPFR_PREC(v) = (cn + dn) * GMP_NUMB_BITS;
224 MPFR_SIGN(u) = MPFR_SIGN(a) * MPFR_SIGN(b);
225 if (sign > 0)
226 MPFR_SIGN(v) = MPFR_SIGN(c) * MPFR_SIGN(d);
227 else
228 MPFR_SIGN(v) = -MPFR_SIGN(c) * MPFR_SIGN(d);
229
230 mpfr_check_range (u, 0, MPFR_RNDN);
231 mpfr_check_range (v, 0, MPFR_RNDN);
232
233 /* tentatively compute z as u+v; here we need z to be distinct
234 from a, b, c, d to not lose the latter */
235 inex = mpfr_add (z, u, v, rnd);
236
237 if (!mpfr_regular_p(z) || !mpfr_regular_p(u) || !mpfr_regular_p(v))
238 {
239 if (mpfr_inf_p (z)) {
240 /* replace by "correctly rounded overflow" */
241 mpfr_set_si (z, (mpfr_signbit (z) ? -1 : 1), MPFR_RNDN);
242 inex = mpfr_mul_2ui (z, z, mpfr_get_emax (), rnd);
243 }
244 else if (mpfr_zero_p (u) && !mpfr_zero_p (v)) {
245 /* exactly u underflowed, determine inexact flag */
246 inex = (mpfr_signbit (u) ? 1 : -1);
247 }
248 else if (mpfr_zero_p (v) && !mpfr_zero_p (u)) {
249 /* exactly v underflowed, determine inexact flag */
250 inex = (mpfr_signbit (v) ? 1 : -1);
251 }
252 else if (mpfr_nan_p (z) || (mpfr_zero_p (u) && mpfr_zero_p (v))) {
253 /* In the first case, u and v are infinities with opposite signs.
254 In the second case, u and v are zeroes; their sum may be 0 or the
255 least representable number, with a sign to be determined.
256 Redo the computations with mpz_t exponents */
257 mpfr_exp_t ea, eb, ec, ed;
258 mpz_t eu, ev;
259 /* cheat to work around the const qualifiers */
260
261 /* Normalise the input by shifting and keep track of the shifts in
262 the exponents of u and v */
263 ea = mpfr_get_exp (a);
264 eb = mpfr_get_exp (b);
265 ec = mpfr_get_exp (c);
266 ed = mpfr_get_exp (d);
267
268 mpfr_set_exp ((mpfr_ptr) a, (mpfr_prec_t) 0);
269 mpfr_set_exp ((mpfr_ptr) b, (mpfr_prec_t) 0);
270 mpfr_set_exp ((mpfr_ptr) c, (mpfr_prec_t) 0);
271 mpfr_set_exp ((mpfr_ptr) d, (mpfr_prec_t) 0);
272
273 mpz_init (eu);
274 mpz_init (ev);
275 mpz_set_si (eu, (long int) ea);
276 mpz_add_si (eu, eu, (long int) eb);
277 mpz_set_si (ev, (long int) ec);
278 mpz_add_si (ev, ev, (long int) ed);
279
280 /* recompute u and v and move exponents to eu and ev */
281 mpfr_mul (u, a, b, MPFR_RNDN);
282 /* exponent of u is non-positive */
283 mpz_sub_ui (eu, eu, (unsigned long int) (-mpfr_get_exp (u)));
284 mpfr_set_exp (u, (mpfr_prec_t) 0);
285 mpfr_mul (v, c, d, MPFR_RNDN);
286 if (sign < 0)
287 mpfr_neg (v, v, MPFR_RNDN);
288 mpz_sub_ui (ev, ev, (unsigned long int) (-mpfr_get_exp (v)));
289 mpfr_set_exp (v, (mpfr_prec_t) 0);
290
291 if (mpfr_nan_p (z)) {
292 mpfr_exp_t emax = mpfr_get_emax ();
293 int overflow;
294 /* We have a = ma * 2^ea with 1/2 <= |ma| < 1 and ea <= emax, and
295 analogously for b. So eu <= 2*emax, and eu > emax since we have
296 an overflow. The same holds for ev. Shift u and v by as much as
297 possible so that one of them has exponent emax and the
298 remaining exponents in eu and ev are the same. Then carry out
299 the addition. Shifting u and v prevents an underflow. */
300 if (mpz_cmp (eu, ev) >= 0) {
301 mpfr_set_exp (u, emax);
302 mpz_sub_ui (eu, eu, (long int) emax);
303 mpz_sub (ev, ev, eu);
304 mpfr_set_exp (v, (mpfr_exp_t) mpz_get_ui (ev));
305 /* remaining common exponent is now in eu */
306 }
307 else {
308 mpfr_set_exp (v, emax);
309 mpz_sub_ui (ev, ev, (long int) emax);
310 mpz_sub (eu, eu, ev);
311 mpfr_set_exp (u, (mpfr_exp_t) mpz_get_ui (eu));
312 mpz_set (eu, ev);
313 /* remaining common exponent is now also in eu */
314 }
315 inex = mpfr_add (z, u, v, rnd);
316 /* Result is finite since u and v have different signs. */
317 overflow = mpfr_mul_2ui (z, z, mpz_get_ui (eu), rnd);
318 if (overflow)
319 inex = overflow;
320 }
321 else {
322 int underflow;
323 /* Addition of two zeroes with same sign. We have a = ma * 2^ea
324 with 1/2 <= |ma| < 1 and ea >= emin and similarly for b.
325 So 2*emin < 2*emin+1 <= eu < emin < 0, and analogously for v. */
326 mpfr_exp_t emin = mpfr_get_emin ();
327 if (mpz_cmp (eu, ev) <= 0) {
328 mpfr_set_exp (u, emin);
329 mpz_add_ui (eu, eu, (unsigned long int) (-emin));
330 mpz_sub (ev, ev, eu);
331 mpfr_set_exp (v, (mpfr_exp_t) mpz_get_si (ev));
332 }
333 else {
334 mpfr_set_exp (v, emin);
335 mpz_add_ui (ev, ev, (unsigned long int) (-emin));
336 mpz_sub (eu, eu, ev);
337 mpfr_set_exp (u, (mpfr_exp_t) mpz_get_si (eu));
338 mpz_set (eu, ev);
339 }
340 inex = mpfr_add (z, u, v, rnd);
341 mpz_neg (eu, eu);
342 underflow = mpfr_div_2ui (z, z, mpz_get_ui (eu), rnd);
343 if (underflow)
344 inex = underflow;
345 }
346
347 mpz_clear (eu);
348 mpz_clear (ev);
349
350 mpfr_set_exp ((mpfr_ptr) a, ea);
351 mpfr_set_exp ((mpfr_ptr) b, eb);
352 mpfr_set_exp ((mpfr_ptr) c, ec);
353 mpfr_set_exp ((mpfr_ptr) d, ed);
354 /* works also when some of a, b, c, d are not all distinct */
355 }
356 }
357
358 free (MPFR_MANT(u));
359 free (MPFR_MANT(v));
360 return inex;
361}
362#endif
363
364int
365mpc_mul_naive (mpc_ptr z, mpc_srcptr x, mpc_srcptr y, mpc_rnd_t rnd)
366{
367 /* computes z=x*y by the schoolbook method, where x and y are assumed
368 to be finite and without zero parts */
369 int overlap, inex;
370 mpc_t rop;
371
372 MPC_ASSERT ( mpfr_regular_p (mpc_realref (x)) && mpfr_regular_p (mpc_imagref (x))
373 && mpfr_regular_p (mpc_realref (y)) && mpfr_regular_p (mpc_imagref (y)));
374 overlap = (z == x) || (z == y);
375 if (overlap)
376 mpc_init3 (rop, MPC_PREC_RE (z), MPC_PREC_IM (z));
377 else
378 rop [0] = z [0];
379
380#if HAVE_MPFR_FMMA
381 inex = MPC_INEX (mpfr_fmms (mpc_realref (rop), mpc_realref (x), mpc_realref (y), mpc_imagref (x),
382 mpc_imagref (y), MPC_RND_RE (rnd)),
383 mpfr_fmma (mpc_imagref (rop), mpc_realref (x), mpc_imagref (y), mpc_imagref (x),
384 mpc_realref (y), MPC_RND_IM (rnd)));
385#else
386 inex = MPC_INEX (mpc_fmma (mpc_realref (rop), mpc_realref (x), mpc_realref (y), mpc_imagref (x),
387 mpc_imagref (y), -1, MPC_RND_RE (rnd)),
388 mpc_fmma (mpc_imagref (rop), mpc_realref (x), mpc_imagref (y), mpc_imagref (x),
389 mpc_realref (y), +1, MPC_RND_IM (rnd)));
390#endif
391
392 mpc_set (z, rop, MPC_RNDNN);
393 if (overlap)
394 mpc_clear (rop);
395
396 return inex;
397}
398
399
400int
401mpc_mul_karatsuba (mpc_ptr rop, mpc_srcptr op1, mpc_srcptr op2, mpc_rnd_t rnd)
402{
403 /* computes rop=op1*op2 by a Karatsuba algorithm, where op1 and op2
404 are assumed to be finite and without zero parts */
405 mpfr_srcptr a, b, c, d;
406 int mul_i, ok, inexact, mul_a, mul_c, inex_re = 0, inex_im = 0, sign_x, sign_u;
407 mpfr_t u, v, w, x;
408 mpfr_prec_t prec, prec_re, prec_u, prec_v, prec_w;
409 mpfr_rnd_t rnd_re, rnd_u;
410 int overlap;
411 /* true if rop == op1 or rop == op2 */
412 mpc_t result;
413 /* overlap is quite difficult to handle, because we have to tentatively
414 round the variable u in the end to either the real or the imaginary
415 part of rop (it is not possible to tell now whether the real or
416 imaginary part is used). If this fails, we have to start again and
417 need the correct values of op1 and op2.
418 So we just create a new variable for the result in this case. */
419 int loop;
420 const int MAX_MUL_LOOP = 1;
421
422 overlap = (rop == op1) || (rop == op2);
423 if (overlap)
424 mpc_init3 (result, MPC_PREC_RE (rop), MPC_PREC_IM (rop));
425 else
426 result [0] = rop [0];
427
428 a = mpc_realref(op1);
429 b = mpc_imagref(op1);
430 c = mpc_realref(op2);
431 d = mpc_imagref(op2);
432
433 /* (a + i*b) * (c + i*d) = [ac - bd] + i*[ad + bc] */
434
435 mul_i = 0; /* number of multiplications by i */
436 mul_a = 1; /* implicit factor for a */
437 mul_c = 1; /* implicit factor for c */
438
439 if (mpfr_cmp_abs (a, b) < 0)
440 {
441 MPFR_SWAP (a, b);
442 mul_i ++;
443 mul_a = -1; /* consider i * (a+i*b) = -b + i*a */
444 }
445
446 if (mpfr_cmp_abs (c, d) < 0)
447 {
448 MPFR_SWAP (c, d);
449 mul_i ++;
450 mul_c = -1; /* consider -d + i*c instead of c + i*d */
451 }
452
453 /* find the precision and rounding mode for the new real part */
454 if (mul_i % 2)
455 {
456 prec_re = MPC_PREC_IM(rop);
457 rnd_re = MPC_RND_IM(rnd);
458 }
459 else /* mul_i = 0 or 2 */
460 {
461 prec_re = MPC_PREC_RE(rop);
462 rnd_re = MPC_RND_RE(rnd);
463 }
464
465 if (mul_i)
466 rnd_re = INV_RND(rnd_re);
467
468 /* now |a| >= |b| and |c| >= |d| */
469 prec = MPC_MAX_PREC(rop);
470
471 mpfr_init2 (v, prec_v = mpfr_get_prec (a) + mpfr_get_prec (d));
472 mpfr_init2 (w, prec_w = mpfr_get_prec (b) + mpfr_get_prec (c));
473 mpfr_init2 (u, 2);
474 mpfr_init2 (x, 2);
475
476 inexact = mpfr_mul (v, a, d, MPFR_RNDN);
477 if (inexact) {
478 /* over- or underflow */
479 ok = 0;
480 goto clear;
481 }
482 if (mul_a == -1)
483 mpfr_neg (v, v, MPFR_RNDN);
484
485 inexact = mpfr_mul (w, b, c, MPFR_RNDN);
486 if (inexact) {
487 /* over- or underflow */
488 ok = 0;
489 goto clear;
490 }
491 if (mul_c == -1)
492 mpfr_neg (w, w, MPFR_RNDN);
493
494 /* compute sign(v-w) */
495 sign_x = mpfr_cmp_abs (v, w);
496 if (sign_x > 0)
497 sign_x = 2 * mpfr_sgn (v) - mpfr_sgn (w);
498 else if (sign_x == 0)
499 sign_x = mpfr_sgn (v) - mpfr_sgn (w);
500 else
501 sign_x = mpfr_sgn (v) - 2 * mpfr_sgn (w);
502
503 sign_u = mul_a * mpfr_sgn (a) * mul_c * mpfr_sgn (c);
504
505 if (sign_x * sign_u < 0)
506 { /* swap inputs */
507 MPFR_SWAP (a, c);
508 MPFR_SWAP (b, d);
509 mpfr_swap (v, w);
510 { int tmp; tmp = mul_a; mul_a = mul_c; mul_c = tmp; }
511 sign_x = - sign_x;
512 }
513
514 /* now sign_x * sign_u >= 0 */
515 loop = 0;
516 do
517 {
518 loop++;
519 /* the following should give failures with prob. <= 1/prec */
520 prec += mpc_ceil_log2 (prec) + 3;
521
522 mpfr_set_prec (u, prec_u = prec);
523 mpfr_set_prec (x, prec);
524
525 /* first compute away(b +/- a) and store it in u */
526 inexact = (mul_a == -1 ?
527 mpfr_sub (u, b, a, MPFR_RNDA) :
528 mpfr_add (u, b, a, MPFR_RNDA));
529
530 /* then compute away(+/-c - d) and store it in x */
531 inexact |= (mul_c == -1 ?
532 mpfr_add (x, c, d, MPFR_RNDA) :
533 mpfr_sub (x, c, d, MPFR_RNDA));
534 if (mul_c == -1)
535 mpfr_neg (x, x, MPFR_RNDN);
536
537 if (inexact == 0)
538 mpfr_prec_round (u, prec_u = 2 * prec, MPFR_RNDN);
539
540 /* compute away(u*x) and store it in u */
541 inexact |= mpfr_mul (u, u, x, MPFR_RNDA);
542 /* (a+b)*(c-d) */
543
544 /* if all computations are exact up to here, it may be that
545 the real part is exact, thus we need if possible to
546 compute v - w exactly */
547 if (inexact == 0)
548 {
549 mpfr_prec_t prec_x;
550 /* v and w are different from 0, so mpfr_get_exp is safe to use */
551 prec_x = SAFE_ABS (mpfr_exp_t, mpfr_get_exp (v) - mpfr_get_exp (w))
552 + MPC_MAX (prec_v, prec_w) + 1;
553 /* +1 is necessary for a potential carry */
554 /* ensure we do not use a too large precision */
555 if (prec_x > prec_u)
556 prec_x = prec_u;
557 if (prec_x > prec)
558 mpfr_prec_round (x, prec_x, MPFR_RNDN);
559 }
560
561 rnd_u = (sign_u > 0) ? MPFR_RNDU : MPFR_RNDD;
562 inexact |= mpfr_sub (x, v, w, rnd_u); /* ad - bc */
563
564 /* in case u=0, ensure that rnd_u rounds x away from zero */
565 if (mpfr_sgn (u) == 0)
566 rnd_u = (mpfr_sgn (x) > 0) ? MPFR_RNDU : MPFR_RNDD;
567 inexact |= mpfr_add (u, u, x, rnd_u); /* ac - bd */
568
569 ok = inexact == 0 ||
570 mpfr_can_round (u, prec_u - 3, rnd_u, MPFR_RNDZ,
571 prec_re + (rnd_re == MPFR_RNDN));
572 /* this ensures both we can round correctly and determine the correct
573 inexact flag (for rounding to nearest) */
574 }
575 while (!ok && loop <= MAX_MUL_LOOP);
576 /* after MAX_MUL_LOOP rounds, use mpc_naive instead */
577
578 if (ok) {
579 /* if inexact is zero, then u is exactly ac-bd, otherwise fix the sign
580 of the inexact flag for u, which was rounded away from ac-bd */
581 if (inexact != 0)
582 inexact = mpfr_sgn (u);
583
584 if (mul_i == 0)
585 {
586 inex_re = mpfr_set (mpc_realref(result), u, MPC_RND_RE(rnd));
587 if (inex_re == 0)
588 {
589 inex_re = inexact; /* u is rounded away from 0 */
590 inex_im = mpfr_add (mpc_imagref(result), v, w, MPC_RND_IM(rnd));
591 }
592 else
593 inex_im = mpfr_add (mpc_imagref(result), v, w, MPC_RND_IM(rnd));
594 }
595 else if (mul_i == 1) /* (x+i*y)/i = y - i*x */
596 {
597 inex_im = mpfr_neg (mpc_imagref(result), u, MPC_RND_IM(rnd));
598 if (inex_im == 0)
599 {
600 inex_im = -inexact; /* u is rounded away from 0 */
601 inex_re = mpfr_add (mpc_realref(result), v, w, MPC_RND_RE(rnd));
602 }
603 else
604 inex_re = mpfr_add (mpc_realref(result), v, w, MPC_RND_RE(rnd));
605 }
606 else /* mul_i = 2, z/i^2 = -z */
607 {
608 inex_re = mpfr_neg (mpc_realref(result), u, MPC_RND_RE(rnd));
609 if (inex_re == 0)
610 {
611 inex_re = -inexact; /* u is rounded away from 0 */
612 inex_im = -mpfr_add (mpc_imagref(result), v, w,
613 INV_RND(MPC_RND_IM(rnd)));
614 mpfr_neg (mpc_imagref(result), mpc_imagref(result), MPC_RND_IM(rnd));
615 }
616 else
617 {
618 inex_im = -mpfr_add (mpc_imagref(result), v, w,
619 INV_RND(MPC_RND_IM(rnd)));
620 mpfr_neg (mpc_imagref(result), mpc_imagref(result), MPC_RND_IM(rnd));
621 }
622 }
623
624 mpc_set (rop, result, MPC_RNDNN);
625 }
626
627clear:
628 mpfr_clear (u);
629 mpfr_clear (v);
630 mpfr_clear (w);
631 mpfr_clear (x);
632 if (overlap)
633 mpc_clear (result);
634
635 if (ok)
636 return MPC_INEX(inex_re, inex_im);
637 else
638 return mpc_mul_naive (rop, op1, op2, rnd);
639}
640
641
642int
643mpc_mul (mpc_ptr a, mpc_srcptr b, mpc_srcptr c, mpc_rnd_t rnd)
644{
645 /* Conforming to ISO C99 standard (G.5.1 multiplicative operators),
646 infinities are treated specially if both parts are NaN when computed
647 naively. */
648 if (mpc_inf_p (b))
649 return mul_infinite (a, b, c);
650 if (mpc_inf_p (c))
651 return mul_infinite (a, c, b);
652
653 /* NaN contamination of both parts in result */
654 if (mpfr_nan_p (mpc_realref (b)) || mpfr_nan_p (mpc_imagref (b))
655 || mpfr_nan_p (mpc_realref (c)) || mpfr_nan_p (mpc_imagref (c))) {
656 mpfr_set_nan (mpc_realref (a));
657 mpfr_set_nan (mpc_imagref (a));
658 return MPC_INEX (0, 0);
659 }
660
661 /* check for real multiplication */
662 if (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_imagref (b)))
663 return mul_real (a, c, b, rnd);
664 if (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_imagref (c)))
665 return mul_real (a, b, c, rnd);
666
667 /* check for purely imaginary multiplication */
668 if (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_realref (b)))
669 return mul_imag (a, c, b, rnd);
670 if (mpfr_zero_p (mpc_realref (c)))
671 return mul_imag (a, b, c, rnd);
672
673 /* If the real and imaginary part of one argument have a very different */
674 /* exponent, it is not reasonable to use Karatsuba multiplication. */
675 if ( SAFE_ABS (mpfr_exp_t,
676 mpfr_get_exp (mpc_realref (b)) - mpfr_get_exp (mpc_imagref (b)))
677 > (mpfr_exp_t) MPC_MAX_PREC (b) / 2
678 || SAFE_ABS (mpfr_exp_t,
679 mpfr_get_exp (mpc_realref (c)) - mpfr_get_exp (mpc_imagref (c)))
680 > (mpfr_exp_t) MPC_MAX_PREC (c) / 2)
681 return mpc_mul_naive (a, b, c, rnd);
682 else
683 return ((MPC_MAX_PREC(a)
684 <= (mpfr_prec_t) MUL_KARATSUBA_THRESHOLD * BITS_PER_MP_LIMB)
685 ? mpc_mul_naive : mpc_mul_karatsuba) (a, b, c, rnd);
686}
